Custom Tables

Source: vignettes/Custom-Tables.Rmd
Custom-Tables.Rmd

Another way to import STATcube Data into R is the use of a custom table. This function requires the three arguments.

  • A database id
  • ids of measures to be imported (type MEASURE or STAT_FUNCTION)
  • ids of fields to be imported (type FIELD or VALUESET)

Based on the database id, the remaining ids can be obtained with sc_schema().

id_db <- "str:database:detouextregsai"
db_schema <- sc_schema_db(id_db)
db_schema
##                                                  levelName     type
## 1  Accomodation statistics as of 1974 according to seasons DATABASE
## 2   ¦--Facts                                                  GROUP
## 3   ¦   ¦--Arrivals                                         MEASURE
## 4   ¦   ¦   °--Arrivals                                         SUM
## 5   ¦   °--Nights spent                                     MEASURE
## 6   ¦       °--Nights spent                                     SUM
## 7   ¦--Mandatory fields                                       GROUP
## 8   ¦   °--Season/Tourism Month                               FIELD
## 9   ¦       ¦--Season/Tourism Month                        VALUESET
## 10  ¦       °--Saison/Tourismusmonat (Ebene +1)            VALUESET
## 11  °--Other Classifications                                  GROUP
## 12      ¦--Tourism commune [ABO]                              FIELD
## 13      ¦   ¦--Tourism commune                             VALUESET
## 14      ¦   °--Regionale Gliederung (Ebene +1)             VALUESET
## 15      ¦--Accomodation establishment                         FIELD
## 16      ¦   ¦--Accomodation establishment                  VALUESET
## 17      ¦   ¦--Beherbergungsbetrieb (Ebene +1)             VALUESET
## 18      ¦   °--Beherbergungsbetrieb (Ebene +2)             VALUESET
## 19      °--Country of origin                                  FIELD
## 20          ¦--Country of origin                           VALUESET
## 21          °--Herkunftsland (Ebene +1)                    VALUESET

Browse the schema to extract the desired ids. The basic idea is to extract the id components of desired measures and fields. If a measure has more than one entry of type STAT_FUNCTION either use the id of the measure to utilize the default function or provide the id of the function. The same is true if a field has several VALUESETs

get_id <- function(x) {print(c(x$type, x$id)); x$id}
id_arrivals <- get_id(db_schema$Facts$Arrivals$Arrivals)
## [1] "STAT_FUNCTION"                              
## [2] "str:statfn:detouextregsai:F-DATA1:F-ANK:SUM"
id_nights_spent <- get_id(db_schema$Facts$`Nights spent`)
## [1] "MEASURE"                                 
## [2] "str:measure:detouextregsai:F-DATA1:F-UEB"
id_time <- get_id(db_schema$`Mandatory fields`$`Season/Tourism Month`)
## [1] "FIELD"                                       
## [2] "str:field:detouextregsai:F-DATA1:C-SDB_TIT-0"
id_region <- get_id(db_schema$`Other Classifications`$`Country of origin`$`Herkunftsland (Ebene +1)`)
## [1] "VALUESET"                                              
## [2] "str:valueset:detouextregsai:F-DATA1:C-C93-2:C-C93SUM-0"

Now the ids can be used in sc_table_custom(). If several ids are used for the argument dimensions or fields, combine them with c() to pass a character vector of ids.

my_response <- sc_table_custom(
  db = id_db,
  measures = c(id_arrivals, id_nights_spent),
  dimensions = c(id_time, id_region)
)
my_response
## An object of class sc_table
## 
## Database:      Accomodation statistics as of 1974 according to seasons 
## Measures:      Arrivals, Nights spent 
## Fields:        Season/Tourism Month, Country of origin 
## 
## Request:       2021-03-01 15:49:59 
## STATcubeR:     0.1.0
